roleset.name: to tell jokes, to tell funnies (jokes!)
roleset.note: JOKE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'joke' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Comparison with 'negotiate'. (from joke.01-v predicate notes)
JOKE-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01. Comparison to verb entry joke.01, which maps to VN class 37.6. No FN for the noun. (from joke.01-n)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: It was only earlier this year that the jovial , easygoing executive -- he-3 likes [*-3] to joke with Americans about how his name is synonymous with twelve [*T*-4]-- was appointed [*-1] deputy president [*T*-2] .
example.arg: about how his name is synonymous with twelve [*T*-4]

example.name: extracted Arg2
example.text: [`` He taught me how [*] to play like a gypsy [*T*-1], '']-2 jokes [*T*-2] the musician .

example.name: All args
example.text: I also listened to his jokes with Kissinger about exporting 10 million female Chinese to the U.S., which stunned the U.S. Secretary of State.
example.arg: about exporting 10 million female Chinese to the U.S.

roleset.name: having a laugh together
roleset.note: JOKE_AROUND-V NOTES: Roles identical to "joke".Frames created by Olga. Edited by Miriam. (from joke.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: joke around
example.text: As long as we go out and have fun and laugh and , you know , I think [0] it takes a lot of pressure off of everyone , but the key is going out and having fun , laughing and joking around , you know , doing the little things that we 've been doing [*T*-1]all year .
